headline.main: BURMA JAPANESE SUFFER NEW RAIDS; American Fliers Continue Their Attacks in the North, Setting Fires in Four Places

lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI, India, May 31 (U.P.) -- American fighter planes, continuing their almost daily attacks on Japanese objectives in the Hukawng Valley area of Northern Burma, yesterday started fires in four enemy settlements and destroyed two motor vehicles, the Tenth United States Air Force reported today.
abstract: India raids: Japanese rept 14 Allied planes downed, 6 others destroyed and mil installations fired during Jap raid on Allied airfield, Chittagong; Brit rept raid was intercepted before it reached target; cite Jap plane losses
